question: Eric has a herb stand at the street bazaar. He sells three kinds of herbs: tulips, sunflowers and roses. He usually sells tulips for $3.2057142857142855 per bundle, sunflowers for $2.520769230769231 per bundle and roses for $5.8580000000000005 per bundle. Eric has no change today, so he has decided to round all his prices to the nearest dollar. If Eric sells 7 bundles of tulips, 27 bundles of sunflowers and 37 bundles of roses, how much will he make?
answer:
Eric will round his tulips up from $3.2057142857142855 to $3, since the number following the 3 is 5 or higher.
Eric will round his sunflowers up from $2.520769230769231 to $3, since the number following the 2 is 5 or higher.
Eric will round his roses up from $5.8580000000000005 to $6, since the number following the 5 is 5 or higher.
Eric sells 7 tulips*$3 = $<<7*3=21>>21
Eric sells 27 sunflowers*$3 = $<<27*3=81>>81
Eric sells 37 roses*$6 = $<<37*6=222>>222
Altogether, Eric will make $21 + $81 + $222 = $<<21+81+222=324>>324
#### 324
